title: 'Shehron mein to barudon ka mausam hai, gaun chalo ye to amrudon ka mausam hai' what does these lines of Rahat Indori means? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let us first convert what you have written in Roman Script into correct Devanaagri script to get the corresponding Hindi (OR Hidustaanii ) text: शहरों में तो बारूदों का मौसम है गांव चलो, ये तो अमरूदों का मौसम है Literal Translation: In the cities, the season is of gun powders, Let us go to the villages, this is the season for guava fruit. Explanation: The poet (Rahat Indori sahib) is inviting us to go to the villages because this is the season for guava fruits which are grown there. In the cities there is firing and shooting going on these days so leave the cities. The poet has rhymed “BARUUDON.” with”AMRUUDON.-

शहरों में तो बारूदों का मौसम है गांव चलो, ये तो अमरूदों का मौसम है Literal Translation: In the cities, the season is of gun powders, Let us go to the villages, this is the season for guava fruit. Explanation: The poet (Rahat Indori sahib) is inviting us to go to the villages because this is the season for guava fruits which are grown there. In the cities there is firing and shooting going on these days so leave the cities
